title: A fresh coat: EU Ecolabel levels up for Paints & Varnishes
summary: The EU Ecolabel criteria for paints and varnishes got a fresh coating! Read more about the revised requirements.

title: New package of measures to boost circular economy and strengthen Europe's plastic recycling
summary: The European Commission has unveiled a first set of pilot actions to accelerate Europe's transition to a circular economy, with a particular focus on the plastics sector.

title: Savour the indoors with EU Ecolabel this winter
summary: This winter, let your interior reflect your sustainable choices, with well-crafted pieces chosen with intention. The EU Ecolabel guides you towards choices that resonate.

title: Commission extends nitrates derogation for Ireland
summary: The Commission extended Ireland's derogation under the Nitrates Directive for a further three years, starting 1 January 2026. This decision follows the approval of the Commission's proposal by Member States on 9 December.

title: Smart and sustainable: the EU Ecolabel as a useful tool in green public procurement
summary: Why should public procurers choose EU Ecolabel products? Click to find out!

title: Commission leads efforts to tackle Baltic Sea challenges
summary: Commissioner Roswall hosted the ‘Our Baltic Conference’ in Stockholm, aimed at addressing environmental challenges facing the region.

title: When pawprint meets footprint
summary: The first animal care product has been awarded the EU Ecolabel. Developed by Catalan manufacturer PROQUIMIA, the certified shampoo is a major step toward sustainable pet hygiene. Discover PROQUIMIA’s story and apply for the label to help ‘paw’ the way in sustainable pet care!

title: One Label. More than 100,000 greener products. One Catalogue.
summary: Explore the revamped online Product Catalogue and discover EU Ecolabel certified goods and services in a few clicks!

title: New EU Ecolabel tender call for stakeholder representation
summary: Good news! The EU Ecolabel Stakeholder Representation call for tender has been published on the EU Funding & Tenders Portal! Think that your organisation could make a difference? Submit your bid!

title: Celebrate 33 years of protecting the EU’s nature and join a Bioblitz near you
summary: European Natura 2000 Day is celebrated every year on 21 May. It marks the inception, 33 years ago, of a revolutionary approach to nature conservation in the EU – a large network of protected nature that maintains opportunities for economic and recreational development.

title: Commission adopts a user-friendly planning tool to support Member States in implementing the Nature Restoration Regulation
summary: The European Commission has adopted an Implementing Regulation that establishes a uniform format for national restoration plans under the Nature Restoration Regulation, which entered into force in August 2024.

title: Montenegro Joins the EU's LIFE Programme for Environment and Climate Action
summary: A cornerstone of the European Union's commitment to environmental protection and climate action, the LIFE programme offers Montenegro support to improve its environmental and climate policies and practices.

title: EU welcomes outcomes of Basel, Rotterdam and Stockholm Conventions COPs
summary: The recent outcomes of Basel, Rotterdam and Stockholm Conventions COPs mark a significant milestone in global efforts to address environmental challenges.

title: The EU Ecolabel keeps greening the absorbent hygiene products’ market
summary: Trust and transparency were the main keywords arising from the webinar “Caring for you, caring for the environment,” which spotlighted the benefits of the EU Ecolabel - the official EU ecolabel for product environmental excellence - in the absorbent hygiene sector.

title: Webinar: Caring for you, caring for the environment: the EU Ecolabel for absorbent hygiene products
summary: Discover how the EU Ecolabel for absorbent hygiene products boosts competitiveness, ensures environmental excellence, and aligns with EU legislation. Join the European Commission’s webinar on 9 April 2025 to explore business benefits and hear from industry leaders. Register now!

title: The EU Ecolabel for cosmetic products webinar
summary: Trustworthy, informative, enlightening and insightful: these were some of the key takeaways from the webinar "When Beauty Meets Green", which aimed to explain the opportunities offered by the EU Ecolabel for cosmetic products.

title: EU Ecolabel Cosmetics Webinar
summary: Join the webinar ‘ When beauty meets green: the EU Ecolabel for cosmetic products ’ on 11 December 2024 to learn all you need to know about the EU Ecolabel, its future perspectives, and the opportunities it offers cosmetics producers to showcase the environmental credentials of their products.

title: EU invests over €380 million in 133 new LIFE projects to support the green transition all around Europe
summary: The Commission has granted today more than €380 million to 133 new projects across Europe under the LIFE Programme for environment and climate action.

title: Nature Restoration Law enters into force
summary: The regulation sets binding targets to restore degraded ecosystems, particularly those with the most potential to capture and store carbon.

title: New legislation gives EU Ecolabel big thumbs up
summary: The EU Ecolabel is preparing for a major boost thanks to the new and upcoming legislation.  Discover how our labelling scheme supports the EU's green transition.

title: New global science highlights business risks from nature loss
summary: The assessment comes as the EU is stepping up its push for greater investment and private finance for nature.

title: New EU rules to stop destruction of unsold clothes and shoes
summary: The measures under the Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation will allow businesses to benefit from a more circular economy.

title: Fresh measures to reduce farmers' dependency on imported fertilisers
summary: The rules take the form of an amendment to the Nitrates Directive.

title: Shipbreaking yards are under-explored hotspots for pollution, finds Turkish study
summary: A new study has found significant concentrations of Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) in sediments off the coast of Turkey. Linked to shipbreaking, these pollutants highlight a need for better management to reduce risks to health and environment.

title: EU forest management still focuses on most profitable services
summary: Despite both social opinion and EU policies advocating forest management for multiple ecosystem services, income from sources other than wood production remains limited. This imbalance may continue without targeted interventions.

title: Better engagement in conservation policymaking: Considering ethical values could foster connection across diverse stakeholders, finds pollinator study
summary: Conservation policy often focuses on nature’s right to exist and benefits to human society. A study of influential stakeholders in pollinator policy now highlights other motivations, including moral concerns and responsibility to future generations.

title: Population ageing is the key driver of future air pollution-related mortality in Greece
summary: A study of future air pollution scenarios in Greece explores the health burden on an ageing population. Strict controls could reduce ozone-related mortality, but the health risks from fine particulates could rise as the population ages.

title: EU reaffirms commitment to science-based multilateralism
summary: Countries are meeting in Geneva for the first Intergovernmental Science-Policy Panel on Chemicals, Waste and Pollution plenary.

title: Restoring wetlands with LIFE Programme's biggest project so far
summary: Wetlands are essential allies in climate resilience, biodiversity protection, and even fighting pollution. The ambitious LIFE HumedalES  is one of the many EU initiatives aiming to protect and restore these valuable resources.
